title: White cop who quit after killing unarmed black woman is charged with murder
text:
Fort Worth Police officer Aaron Dean is charged with murder for shooting Atatiana Jefferson at her home on Saturday. (Picture: Fort Worth Police/CBS)

A white police officer who resigned before he was fired for killing and unarmed black woman in her own home has been charged with murder.

Fort Worth Police officer Aaron Dean was arrested Monday evening, two days after shooting Atatiana Jefferson, 28, through her bedroom window as she babysat her eight-year-old niece.

Dean had been conducting a welfare check at Jefferson’s home after a neighbor reported her front door was open. Body cam footage shows the officer firing one shot at Jefferson through her closed window – less than a full second after of seeing her.

Interim Fort Worth Police Chief Ed Kraus said he planned to fire Dean on Monday, but Dean quickly resigned first. He was later taken into police custody at approximately 6pm, Kraus said.

His arrest came after Jefferson’s murder sparked outrage across the US and throughout Texas, the state with the second-highest number of people killed by law enforcement officers this year, the Washington Post reported.

At a news conference on Monday night, Kraus said: ‘To the citizens and residents of our city, we feel and understand your anger and your disappointment and we stand by you as we work together to make Fort Worth a better place for us all.’

Dean was booked at the Tarrant Couny Jail, but was released hours later after he made his $200,000 bond.

Lee Merritt, a civil rights lawyer representing Jefferson’s family, said the investigation into Dean should not be conducted by his former employer, the Fort Worth Police Department, which Merritt said was ‘on track to be one of the deadliest police departments in the United States.’

Instead, he suggested that an outside agency should lead the investigation.

Dean had been employed by the Fort Worth Police department since April 2018.

In the wake of the shooting, officials said Dean and other officers responding to Jefferson’s home did not park their marked police cruisers in front of her house, nor did they identify themselves as police.

Fort Worth Mayor Betsy Price released a statement, apologizing to Jefferson’s niece who watched his aunt die.

‘Sorry doesn’t really cut it. This entire city needs to surround him with prayers, support, and anything his family needs,’ Price said.
description: Police officer Aaron Dean was arrested Monday evening for shooting Atatiana Jefferson, 28, through her bedroom window in Fort Worth, Texas.
